title: Conclusion drawn from survey data - impact

content.question: A software company wants to develop new features to attract new users to download a popular application. The company created a survey to ask users how they feel about several potential new features. The company sent the survey to all users who spent more than 500 hours using the application during the previous year. A programmer for the company wants to determine which new features should be prioritized by performing an analysis of the survey data. Which of the following best explains why the programmer should be careful about the conclusions drawn from the analysis?

choices.label: The survey data may be biased in favor of a specific group of users.
The survey data may include responses from users who dislike the application.
The survey data may raise intellectual property concerns for the company.
The survey data may require data encapsulation before they can be analyzed.

content.answer: The survey data may be biased in favor of a specific group of users.

topic.text: 4.1: Ethical and Social Issues Around Data Collection

skill.text: 5.A: Explain how computing impacts society, economy, and culture.
